title: SpaceX plans to send two civilians around the moon next year
text:
SpaceX plans to send two civilians around the moon next year Fly me to the moon SpaceX By Leah Crane 
SpaceX just announced a plan for beginning the era of space tourism : in late 2018, the space travel company plans to send two private citizens around the moon and back again. 
“Like the Apollo astronauts before them, these individuals will travel into space carrying the hopes and dreams of all humankind, driven by the universal human spirit of exploration,” said a SpaceX press release. But they’ll also be driven by lots and lots of money. Fly me to the moon … Ok https://t.co/6QT8m5SHwn Advertisement 
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) February 27, 2017 
The two individuals, whose names were not released, will be paying an also-undisclosed but “significant” amount of money to be the first civilians to circle the moon. 
SpaceX plans to launch them aboard a Crew Dragon spacecraft atop a Falcon Heavy rocket, neither of which have been tested in space yet. 
The Crew Dragon is scheduled to make its first test flight to the International Space Station, without people aboard, in November of this year. Its first crewed flight is scheduled for May 2018. The first Falcon Heavy launch is planned for sometime in early 2017. 
Given the fact that the spacecraft haven’t been fully tested yet, let alone vetted for humans, a crewed launch in 2018 seems like an optimistic timeline. Some observers are sceptical. I'm doubtful of such a tight timeline as @SpaceX yet to take @NASA astronauts into orbit or successful launching of new Falcon Heavy rocket 
— Alan Duffy (@astroduff) February 27, 2017 What Mika said. This is cool, but no way is it going to happen in 2018. Elon calendar correction as usual. Probably 2020 at best. https://t.co/NwK54zVoAp 
But last year, when SpaceX announced plans to send a Dragon capsule to Mars by 2018 , the mood was optimistic. 
“I wouldn’t put anything past these folks,” said Jim Bell of Arizona State University in Tempe at the time. 
This story is being updated as we learn more.
